item.title: Drum and bass
item.dc:creator: @asyo4 asyo4
item.description:
@asyo4 wrote:

[quote=“Pwnd, post:2, topic:534713”]I’d suggest you start working on some EQing/compressing/sidechaining. You’ve got the jist down. Now start cleaning it up.

May I ask, do you have a set of drum samples that you use by default? I would like them. Most of my drums sound pretty weak and I have far too many samples to go through haha.[/quote]
Yeah, right after I posted that snippet on soundcloud I started the cleaning-up process, I put it together in like an hour and thought it sounded awesome so I put it up

And yeah, sure. These samples are actually off of a free vinyl soundpack I found online, and sounded like shit at first. Proper compression, eqing, mastering and some reverb(very small) polished them up.

Here’s the pack I got most of the samples out of: http://rhythm-lab.com/tags/vinyl
Any samples that arent in there are probably vengeance lol

Read full topic

item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

I’d suggest you start working on some EQing/compressing/sidechaining. You’ve got the jist down. Now start cleaning it up.

May I ask, do you have a set of drum samples that you use by default? I would like them. Most of my drums sound pretty weak and I have far too many samples to go through haha.
